summary: This is a memorandum from the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) documenting a voluntary interview with Correctional Officer Tova Noel regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on August 10, 2019. The document lists numerous attachments including the interview transcript, training records, and operational logs from the MCC.

keyFacts: The DOJ OIG conducted a voluntary interview with Correctional Officer Tova Noel on June 22, 2021, as part of its investigation into the death of Jeffrey Epstein.
Tova Noel was assigned to the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York on August 10, 2019, the day Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell.
The interview was recorded and transcribed, and numerous attachments were included with the memorandum, such as training schedules, sign-in sheets, assignment rosters, and cell pictures.
Noel was represented by attorneys Jason Foy and Eric Sarraga, as well as a BOP union representative, during the OIG interview.
The document is an investigative memorandum that contains no recommendations or conclusions from the OIG.
